mdRecord.dcterms:description: The Arlington Memorial Bridge crosses the Potomac River between the National Mall near the Lincoln Memorial and Columbia Island at Memorial Drive on the southern side. Project first proposed in the McMillan Plan for the monumental core and park system of Washington, D. C. in 1902. The bridge was constructed with a central bascule (drawbridge), which was permanently closed in 1961 and replaced in 2018 by one that does not open. â€” https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arlington_Memorial_Bridge [work]
